article.headline: TCU 76, UAB 65
article.story: FORT WORTH, Texas (AP) -- Nile Murry scored 17 points as TCU won its third straight with a 76-65 victory over UAB. Corey Santee added 16 points, all in the second half, as TCU (16-9, 6-5 Conference USA) improved to 13-2 at home this season. The Horned Frogs rallied from a six-point halftime deficit by scoring 47 of their points in the second half. Donell Taylor led UAB (16-7, 6-4) with 19 points. Marques Lewis had 10 points and 13 rebounds for the Blazers, who have now lost back-to-back games for the first time this season. It was UAB's first game since starter Ronell Taylor was lost indefinitely with a broken ankle in a loss to No. 9 Louisville on Feb. 5. It marked the first time in four meetings TCU has beaten the Blazers.
